unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Are You Covered, Yaar?
normalised: rental agreements: are you covered, yaar?

unnormalised: Mumbai: So, you’ve found your dream apartment in Bandra, close to your office and just a stone's throw from Mannat (Shah Rukh Khan's house!). But hold on, before you start humming "Ae Kya Bolti Tu," let's talk rental agreements, folks.
normalised: Mumbai: so, you've found your dream apartment in Bandra, close to your office and just a stone's throw from Mannat (Shah Rukh Khan's house!). But hold on, before you start humming "Ae Kya Bolti Tu," let's talk rental agreements, folks.

unnormalised: Turns out, a lot of tenants and landlords are still fuzzy on the details. A recent survey by the National Housing Bank showed that nearly 60% of rental agreements in Mumbai are missing key clauses.
normalised: Turns out, a lot of tenants and landlords are still fuzzy on the details. A recent survey by the N A T I O N A L Housing Bank showed that nearly sixty percent of rental agreements in Mumbai are missing key clauses.

unnormalised: Things like security deposit amounts (Rs. 50,000 is typical, right?), lock-in periods, and who pays for what (minor repairs, society maintenance - everything!) are often vague.
normalised: Things like security deposit amounts (rupees fifty thousand is typical, right?), lock-in periods, and who pays for what (minor repairs, society maintenance - everything!) are often vague.

unnormalised: Imagine getting stuck with a leaking tap and your landlord doing a 'Munna Bhai' – completely ignoring you!
normalised: Imagine getting stuck with a leaking tap and your landlord doing a 'Munna Bhai' – completely ignoring you!

unnormalised: Experts recommend clearly outlining everything, even pet policies (Mr. Sharma’s Pomeranian, Sheru, needs his space!). Get it registered, even if it costs a few extra rupees. A well-drafted agreement can save you a lot of headaches later, preventing it from becoming a real-life "Khosla Ka Ghosla" situation. Remember, transparency is key!
normalised: Experts recommend clearly outlining everything, even pet policies (Mister Sharma’s Pomeranian, Sheru, needs his space!). Get it registered, even if it costs a few extra rupees. A well-drafted agreement can save you a lot of headaches later, preventing it from becoming a real-life "Khosla Ka Ghosla" situation. Remember, transparency is key!
